text: Grodzka Street (Polish: Ulica Grodzka, lit. Gord Street) - one of the oldest streets in Kraków, Poland. The street fell along line a former north-to-south trade route. The street is part of the Royal Route, used by Polish kings to reach the Wawel Castle. The earliest documents of its name derive from the thirteenth-century. ==Features== {| |----- bgcolor="#FF 8C 00" ! width=4% | Street No. ! width=26% | Short description ! width=10% | Picture |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 40 || align="center"| Stadnicki Palace - a nineteenth-century palace with a rococo façade. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 52 || align="center"| Former Jesuit Collegium from the first-quarter of the seventeenth-century. The Jesuits opened a school here, as to compete with the Jagiellonian University. Presently, the building is home to the Collegium Broscianum of the Jagiellonian University. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 54 || align="center"| Saints Peter and Paul Church - a Roman Catholic, Polish Baroque church, built in the early seventeenth-century. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 56 || align="center"| St. Andrew's Church - a historical Romanesque church, built in the late eleventh-century as a fortress church used for defensive purposes. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 58 || align="center"| St. Martin's Church - a Lutheran/Calvinist church, built in the first half of the seventeenth-century. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 65 || align="center"| Gniezno Bishop's Palace - a palace from the seventeenth-century, rebuilt in the Classicist architectural style in the nineteenth-century. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 64 || align="center"| Royal Arsenal - built in 1643. Presently, the building houses the Institute of Geography and Spatial Management of the Jagiellonian University. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 67 || align="center"| Church of St. Giles - a church built in the fourteenth-century. || align="center"| 100px |} ==References== Category:Streets in Kraków
title: Grodzka Street, Kraków
